Chapter 5 Common Task 5.1 Code Snippets # Remove duplicated tweets dat %>% distinct(status_id, .keep_all = TRUE) # Alternatively dat %>% filter(!duplicated(status_id)) # Remove retweets from dataset dat %>% filter(!is_retweet) # Round every numeric column in data frame to two digits (APA Standard) dat %>% mutate_if(is.numeric, round, digits = 2) # Sort all columns alphabetically dat[, order(colnames(dat))] # Alternatively dat %>% select(sort(current_vars())) # Reorder each column alphabetically map_df(dat, function(col) { sort(col, na.last = TRUE) }) # Group and mutate (useful with collapse pasting) group_by(status_id) %>% mutate( all_methods = paste(method, collapse = ", ") ) 5.2 Regex Insights # Regex to match hashtags "#[[:alnum:]_]+" # Shorter synonym "#\\w+" # Look for hashtags without overmatching str_detect(text, regex("#XXXX(\\W|$)", ignore_case = TRUE)) # (\\W|$) means anything but word characters or a string ending # Quick method to generate a longer regex query from a list of hashtags regex <- hashtags %>% paste(collapse = "(\\W|$)|") %>% paste0("(\\W|$)") # Use `iconv` to retain the unicode hex for any character iconv("üá©üá™") # > "\U0001f1e9\U0001f1ea" # Common text cleaning operation text %>% tolower() %>% str_replace_all("√§", "ae") %>% str_replace_all("√∂", "oe") %>% str_replace_all("√º", "ue") %>% str_replace_all("√ü", "ss")
